title: Sports Broadcasters React To Domestic Violence In The NFL
teaser: Even with multi-million dollar contracts between networks and the NFL, some sportscasters are excoriating the NFL over its response to players accused of domestic violence.
contentencoded:
CBS, ESPN, and other TV networks have multi-million dollar contracts with the NFL.

So how are they dealing with recent controversies regarding domestic violence in the league?

Last week, James Brown of CBS delivered a blunt critique of NFL culture, and Sunday ESPN’s Hannah Storm gave a powerful monologue questioning the NFL’s values.

NPR’s media correspondent David Folkenflick talks to Here & Now’s Robin Young about how broadcast networks are reacting to the Ray Rice and Adrian Peterson scandals.

Guest

  • David Folkenflik, media correspondent for NPR. He tweets @davidfolkenflik.
